Aug 2012 – May 2014
Took French language courses
Co-taught and gave interactive workshops in Chinese and English for French
students for their vocabulary, writing, pronunciation and Chinese culture
Chinatown Justice Project, New York, NY
Summer
Organized Chinatown residents – youth, low-wage workers, and tenants – against
community-wide displacement and gentrification in order to preserve Chinatown as
a neighborhood for working class Asian immigrants
Conducted surveys and campaigns with residents to play a key role in community-
led development and that those processes are democratic, equitable, and just
Cross Cultural Solutions Nursing Home, San Carlos, Costa Rica
June - August 2010
Organized activities such as exercises or workshops (sewing, cooking, handicraft,
etc)
Assisted nursing staff in physiotherapy and medical care for 80 residents
Designed and constructed murals to induce visual and cognitive stimulation for
residents
Fujian Provincial Hospital, Fujian, China
June-
August 2009
Assisted staff in patient care areas, providing information and services to families
and working in clerical or office capacities sorting and translating patient
information
Ensured a comfortable and satisfying stay for patients and visitors through visiting
and tending to their simple needs
Prepared and assisted nurses in gathering materials and running tests including
urine tests, blood tests, cholesterol level tests, chest x-rays, and electrocardiograms

text.b: Asian American Studies Association, Columbia University Teacher’s College

page.text: Collaborated with public school teachers, administrators, and counselors in NY and
NJ K-12 schools to explore issues that impact our increasingly large Asian American
student population
Researched on how to effectively interact with Asian American students in the
classroom and to incorporate Asian American into U.S. History, World History,
Language Arts, and Literature curriculum
Citizen’s Committee for Children, New York, NY

text.i: Team Facilitator/ Community Advocate / Peer Mentor

page.text: Collaborated in developing guidelines for effective community improvement
strategies
Trained youths in different high schools in NYC on how they can help improve their
communities through peer training
Developed and conducted surveys in under-resourced neighborhood to assess
residents’ perspectives on community services
Lobbied recommendations requesting for community improvement and educational
reform in City Hall and Albany
Visiting Nurse Services of New York, New York, NY

text.i: Assistant to the Communications Manager in Human Resources

page.text: Assisted the communications manager with filing and making new changes to the
company’s award website
Took phone calls and maintain the monthly schedule for the Communications
Manager
Organize and design drafts of award posters
Sorted files related to employee relations and complaints

SKILLS:
Proficient in PERL programming, and R Program for Statistical Computing, Microsoft Word,
Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint. Fluent in Chinese (Mandarin, and Fujianese) and in French
(level B2). Certified Emergency Medical Technician (EMT)
